content.description: Climb very powerful and bouldery route just right of How I Spent My Summer Vacation.
content.location: Start on boulder just right of How I Spent My Summer Vacation.

content.description: Starts with a layback with a couple pieces of smaller gear. Then four bolts to chains.
content.location: To the right and downhill of I Can’t Believe it. To the left of Slabbage Patch.

content.description: The crag's namesake is old school "sport" climbing -- runout and gear required -- but guaranteed to be memorable for anyone who decides to take the sharp end and take the leap for the starting holds.  Begin with a hand rail and no-hands stand up to the first bolt (ankles be damned, unless you cheat and stick clip), followed by insecure smearing to a thank god flake, maybe expanding but at least its big.  Jam a cam or two in the flake (remember the expanding part), then relatively easier climbing gets to another bolt.  Buckle-up here to get to the next bolt, then confront the crux, and clip and grin your way to the anchors cuz you flashed a good one.  Gym rats likely will be terrified, but I wouldn't change a thing.
content.protection: Draws for four bolts and the anchors, and some select hand-or-thereabouts cams for the flake.
content.location:
Walk up the hill from

Deez

.  Look for a bolt a good ways up, below a huge horizontal downward-facing flake.  Lower from anchors.

content.description: Start right of the line of bolts and either hand traverse or do some OW moves along a large horizontal crack. A small cam (green alien) can be placed to protect the first clip.  Follow the fun patina face climbing above to a juggy roof finish.  This climb is worth the hike up the hill.
content.protection: handful of bolts and optional small cam
content.location: This route is located high on the formation just to the right of a couple hard short sport climbs.

climbs.name: How I Spent My Summer Vacation

content.description: Climb up steep layback section of rock.  Super fun and very powerful!
content.location: Up hill and left from I Can't Believe it.  Just left of Thugs in the Gym.

content.description: Start up on a small ledge.  Stem up a chimney and reach across to steep jugs.  The clip is a little ways up there.  A few hard tugs leads to easier climbing above.  A fun route...
content.protection: 5 bolts, then run out to chains
content.location: The first route near the bottom of the SW face.
